About Version Labels

Version labels are tags used to identify a particular revision. You can use version labels to select multiple files to check in or check out, promote, generate reports on, or use to build an application.

Typically, version labels are used to identify a particular revision for each component of a specific product release, such as "Beta Test 1." You can assign version labels to single revisions (fixed), or you can assign version labels that move with the latest revision of a file (floating).
